title: Product Hate Framework - Solve What People Hate, Not What They Want
summary: People don't know what they want, but they KNOW what pisses them off. Focus on eliminating hatred, not adding features. You're not building software - you're eliminating reasons to be pissed off at computers.

the_framework.step_1: Efficient AI + Knowledge - context that persists, no re-explaining
the_framework.step_2: Automation tools - compound returns, feed the system
the_framework.step_3: Solve what everyone HATES - not what they say they want

universal_computer_hatred: where the fuck did that file go
what_people_actually_want: the thing to just fucking work

examples.apple: Got rich on 'it just works' - not a feature list, absence of hatred
examples.google_search: One box, type, get answer - no menus, no options, no bullshit
examples.phishri: AI remembers context - eliminates the hatred of re-explaining

antipatterns: adding options instead of making decisions
listening to what users say vs watching what they hate
wisdom: People are fickle about wants, consistent about hatred
You're not building software - you're eliminating reasons to be pissed off
The best feature is the absence of friction
Nobody wakes up wanting features - they wake up pissed off at problems

author: BMETALC
